poem:
Zohran in the City

In the heart of New York,  
a pulse beats steady,  
echoing voices—  
dreams woven with care—  
where bridges form  
not from cement or steel  
but words and deeds  
that thread together  
a tapestry diverse,  
thriving alongside neighbors,  
casting votes for unity  
in a city where  
everyone has a place  
beneath the shared sky.
